intro: Espadaea apiculata, commonly known as the pointed leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
